title: Cross-Site Scripting (XSS)
desc: Cross-Site Scripting is a common web vulnerability consisting of injecting client-side code (mostly JavaScript) to target users of a web application. It allows the attacker to execute malicious scripts in the victim's browser despite being on a legitimate web page. As explained on Acunetix.com, the web page or web application becomes a vehicle to deliver the malicious script to the user (victim).
